TopicTitle: [BACE, Carts] LGV: Stable, safe car that goes high speeds!

Articles.Content:
I was messing around with the carts mod and came up with this design. It uses a command module from the BACE mod and the cart from the Carts mod. (Made this in .15, not the latest update because I\'ve heard of some really bad glitches that came with it)

Max Speed: 102 --Fastest I got when going straight on flatish land

Average Speed: 90 --Again, on flatish land

Break time: 6-10 seconds --Breaks from 102 m/s to 0 in around that time, and does not flip over!

Turning the car: It\'s safe to just hold down J or L from 0 to 60 m/s, however it will flip from around 70+, so just quickly tap the keys instead of holding them down.

I had quite a bit of fun with this thing, I just drove around for a few minutes and jumped hills every now and then. This cart seems to be really stable because of the BACE command module, as it is just a cylinder. 

(Headlights can be turned on by pressing U, if you don\'t know.)

**EDIT: Messed around mountains with it, you need to control it when it\'s mid-air using the WASD keys to keep it steady. Added a picture of me flying off of a mountain.**

Those wingboards are intriguing. I assume the extra lift they give you makes jumping things more fun, but also could pose some stability issues on a long jump. Does the lack of vertical stabilizers cause issues?

The wing things are just to make the cart bit look less bland. I don\'t think it gives much lift. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I\'ve not tried actually jumping off of really big hills, I only ran into really short ones where I got air for like a second or so.
Well, I DL\'d the .craft, tried to jump the ramp to the launchpad, and spun wayyyyyy out of control. I\'d say it\'s a fairly successful design.
